intro: Kaunia rufescens, commonly known as the red-stemmed flax, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly referred to as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender, reddish stems and small, clustered greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a smooth texture, often covered in a fine layer of hair. Kaunia rufescens is adapted to grow in dry, sunny environments and is often found in grasslands and rocky soils.
